title: Holiday Movies‚Ä¶. Is it all about Christmas?
text:
Problem at hand
The human calendar is consist of 12 months and out of this 12 one specific month, December is what seems magical. Well we are exactly 3 months away from Christmas and Mariah Carey is almost finished defrosting üòâ.
Holiday movies are often thought of as family-friendly, with Christmas taking the spotlight year after year. But is that all there is to it? This analysis looks at the distribution of genres in holiday movies and asks whether movies for holidays can shift from Family Themed movies to more edgy, demanding genre types of movies.
We‚Äôre exploring whether the film industry‚Äôs focus on Christmas is fair, and what might happen if more movies started highlighting other holidays. Could this shift change the future of holiday movies and give audiences something new to celebrate?

title: Holiday Movies‚Ä¶. Is it all about Christmas?
text:
Data to be identfied
As for this blog post the data was retrieved from the ‚ÄúTidyTuesday‚Äù Git Repository which provides the Holiday movie dataset.

Data Description
There are mainly two datasets which have been used for this analysis, which are holiday_movies.csv and holiday_movie_genre.csv. In this blog I won‚Äôt be talking about the entire two datasets but only the key factors of the two.
In the holiday_movies.csv contains the movies which have been produced from 1929-2023. There are many types of movies which have been produced over the years. There are 2265 observations and 14 variables. These variables consist of the movie name, unique identifier of the title (tconst), year of the movie released, genre, movie run time and average ratings of IMDb, these are some of the key variables of the dataset.
In the holiday_movie_genre.csv contains the genre of the movies. As readers you might be wondering why there is another table for movie genre when you can find it in the first table itself? The reason for it is that for analysis purpose. In movies it is common to have more than one genre and in the first table in a single row it contains more than one genre but for analysis purpose it is hard as a solution if a movie has more than one genre it has been broken into single value. This is that advantage which anyone will have from using the TidyTuesday Git Repository as it contains lot of intial cleaning of the data. In this dataset it contains 4531 observations and 2 variables which are unique identifier of the title (tconst) and genres.


Data Cleaning
The dataset used in this analysis was obtained from the TidyTuesday repository and came pre-cleaned. No additional significant cleaning was required before analysis. The data was structured in a way that facilitated direct analysis, allowing us to dive straight into understanding genre distributions, rating trends, and holiday representations.
Although some cleaning was done for this analysis in the holiday_movie_genre.csv there were some genre which are not related to movies such as Music, Talk-Show, News, Reality-TV, Sport were filtered out.
Also in holiday_movies.csv the variables which contains of Christmas, Hanukkah and Kwanzaa were logical factors and for analysis purpose it was converted into integer factor.

Interesting facts to be seen in here, Christmas themed movies are what has taken the center stage in holiday movies and it is not looking good but can‚Äôt blame anyone, Christmas is what people looks forward to.
The businesses has put it focus on what makes them profit and that is Christmas, whether you like it or not, that‚Äôs the truth (Being part Catholic I stand by my views). Even in countries where you don‚Äôt get to see many people who celebrate Christmas do come together to enjoy the festivity. So my question is if a business can make Christmas into a business Icon why can‚Äôt they do same for the other holidays? In business world if a certain product has a monopoly and only way to break that monopoly is by introducing another competitor(s) into the mix. Which in this case Kwanzaa and Hanukkah.
If film a production companies come forward and decide to promote other holidays it will change the outcome of the Table¬†1 and gradually people will focus on other holidays as well. Especially Kwanzaa is a celebration of the African American culture which is very heartwarming and Hanukkah is celebrated by Jewish and it is regarding their redemption over the enemy. title: Holiday Movies‚Ä¶. Is it all about Christmas?
text:
Conclusion
It‚Äôs clear that Christmas dominates the holiday movie business, with family-friendly films leading the way. However, as we saw in the genre breakdown in Figure¬†1, there‚Äôs room for other genres and holidays to gain more attention. Movies like ‚ÄúRed One‚Äù suggest that the demand for action-packed or alternative holiday films are growing, especially with younger audiences.
The representation of holidays like Hanukkah and Kwanzaa is almost nonexistent, as shown in Table¬†1, which raises the question: why aren‚Äôt more movies celebrating these occasions? If the film industry began focusing on other holidays, it could open up new opportunities and bring more diversity to holiday storytelling.
In short, Christmas and Family Friendly movies has held the spotlight for a long time, but it‚Äôs time to consider how other holidays and genre could enrich the holiday movie landscape.
